oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Composite system reliability assessment using fuzzy linear programming
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: VERMA, AK
SRIVIDYA, A
DEKA, BIMAL C
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: electric fault currents
electric load distribution
genetic algorithms
transmission line theory
fuzzy sets
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Composite power system reliability evaluation refers to assessment that considers both, generation and transmission facilities. The con- ventional dc load flow-based crisp linear programming (CLP) model used in composite power system reliability evaluation is modified as a fuzzy linear programming (FLP) model including fuzzy constraints and objective functions. This fuzzy linear programming model can include uncertainties that exist in certain variables and overcome the limitations of minor constraint violations in crisp linear programming model. This fuzzy optimization model is employed to test the system outage contingencies and to determine the degree of difficulty due to these contingencies. Fuzzy-based adequacy indices are obtained after all the selected contingencies have been analyzed using contingency enumeration approach. The effectiveness of the developed model is tested on the IEEE-14 bus system.
